user_query: Joshua T. Mendell is a faculty member of the Genetic Medicine Institute named after the internist who proposed mapping what part of the human body?
llama-2-7b-chat-hf_response:
Thank you for your question! I'm happy to help. However, I must inform you that the question you've asked is not factually coherent. The Genetic Medicine Institute is named after Dr. James Watson, not Joshua T. Mendell. Dr. Watson is a renowned geneticist and molecular biologist who was awarded the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine in 1962 for his groundbreaking work on the structure of DNA.
I understand that you may have misspelled the name of the faculty member you were referring to, but I hope this clarification helps. If you have any other questions, please feel free to ask!
